Pavel Rogala

Hi, I'm Pavel.

I'm a web developer, copywriter, and part-time musician.

Life

and the things I love to do...

...at work.

I'm a lead developer on the Stereofund project, which also happens to be home for some of the most awesome people ever. I write about web development and run a company in Novi Sad, Serbia that provides an introductory course on front-end development. I also moonlight as a copywriter and consultant for The Media Cocktail.

...in my free time.

I live with my lovely and talented girlfriend and spend a lot of my free time running after our two dogs or "helping" with her arts and crafts project Turquoise Arrow. I also play guitar with a few other odd individuals in a band we call FYN. I enjoy reading Tom Clancy, watching terrible 80's action movies, seeing my girlfriend freak out over horror flicks, playing Call f Duty, or pitting our two dogs against each other in tug of war ... to the death (of boredom).

Things

that I care about, blog about, and teach.

Privacy

A lifelong privacy and security geek, my public key is available at MIT's Public Key Server. Remember to prepend 0x before searching by hexadecimal KeyID.
A266F8B6
Oh and here's my PGP Key Fingerprint, so you can be sure that I'm the one receiving your deep, dark, && secret revelations :)
15F2 ECE4 1162 88C6 A926 DE9D 48C8 448E A266 F8B6

Coding

I first got into code tinkering as a kid when I realized I could make my very own MS Word clone in Visual Basic. I called it Maxisoft Type, created a proprietary extension, and quit Visual Basic in favor of C and PHP a couple weeks later.

Ten years later, I've opened a small school that teaches introductory courses on web development to students, hobbyists, and the occasional hipster. I love to share what I've learned over the years so I've started my own blog, and will becovering everything from Laravel and jQuery to team management and dealing with stress.

Dogs

Because who doesn't need a best friend. Lucky enough to have grown up around dogs my entire life, I finally picked up a little mutt of my own a few years after leaving the parents (the coolest btw). Now with a second amazing dog in the picture, my girlfriend and I have our hands full, and no regrets.

Whenever I can I'll slam animal abusers (and wannabe abusers) around social networks, give some treats or a drink to the strays still looking for a caring home, and trying my best to connect those amazing dogs with the same.
